edu.rit.image

Class Gray

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.rit.image.Gray
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Streamable

    public class Gray
extends Object
implements Streamable
    Class Gray provides a gray shade.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Gray()
      Construct a new gray object with a gray shade of black.
      Gray(Gray gray)
      Construct a new gray object that is a copy of the given gray object.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Gray

        public Gray()
        Construct a new gray object with a gray shade of black.

    • Method Detail

      • gray

        public int gray()
        Get the gray shade of this gray object. The gray shade is an integer in the range 0 (black) through 255 (white).
        Returns:
        Gray shade.

      • gray

        public Gray gray(int shade)
        Set this gray object to the given gray shade. The gray shade is an integer in the range 0 (black) through 255 (white). Only bits 7-0 are used.
        Parameters:
        shade - Gray shade.
        Returns:
        This gray object.

      • gray

        public Gray gray(int shade,
        boolean zeroIsBlack)
        Set this gray object to the given gray shade. The gray shade is an integer in the range 0 through 255. Only bits 7-0 are used. If zeroIsBlack is true, then 0 = black and 255 = white. If zeroIsBlack is false, then 0 = white and 255 = black.
        Parameters:
        shade - Gray shade.
        zeroIsBlack - True if 0 = black, false if 0 = white.
        Returns:
        This gray object.

      • gray

        public Gray gray(float shade)
        Set this gray object to the given gray shade. The gray shade is a floating point number in the range 0.0f (black) through 1.0f (white). Values outside that range are pinned to that range.
        Parameters:
        shade - Gray shade.
        Returns:
        This gray object.

      • gray

        public Gray gray(float shade,
        boolean zeroIsBlack)
        Set this gray object to the given gray shade. The gray shade is a floating point number in the range 0.0f through 1.0f. Values outside that range are pinned to that range. If zeroIsBlack is true, then 0.0f = black and 1.0f = white. If zeroIsBlack is false, then 0.0f = white and 1.0f = black.
        Parameters:
        shade - Gray shade.
        zeroIsBlack - True if 0.0f = black, false if 0.0f = white.
        Returns:
        This gray object.

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Returns a string version of this gray object. The string is in hexadecimal HTML format; for example, "#121212".
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
        Returns:
